DataElement.preferredDefinition: Date the demographic and tumor identification information on a single primary/reportable neoplasm, compiled from one or more source records, from one or more facilities, is available in the central cancer registry database to be counted as an incident tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The demographic and tumor identification information on a single primary/reportable neoplasm, compiled from one or more source records, from one or more facilities, is available in the central cancer registry database to be counted as an incident tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The type of change made to an element.:To take precedence over and countermand, thereby allowing an activity to continue despite a warning or error.

Concepts.definition: The type of change made to an element.
To take precedence over and countermand, thereby allowing an activity to continue despite a warning or error.

Property.preferredDefinition: (NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.:Record; anything, e.g. a document, providing permanent evidence of or information about past events.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
Anything (e.g., a document) providing permanent evidence of or information about past events.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Date Tumor Record Avaibl Description
